intro: Dalechampia stipulacea var. piauhiensis, commonly known as the Piauhi dalechampia, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and unique inflorescence structure. The plant typically features heart-shaped leaves with prominent veins and produces small, clustered flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
